user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_set_connection_value_n_nocheck_:
```c
static enum MHD_Result
MHD_set_connection_value_n_nocheck_ (struct MHD_Connection *connection,
                                     enum MHD_ValueKind kind,
                                     const char *key,
                                     size_t key_size,
                                     const char *value,
                                     size_t value_size)
{
  struct MHD_HTTP_Req_Header *pos;

  pos = MHD_connection_alloc_memory_ (connection,
                                      sizeof (struct MHD_HTTP_Res_Header));
  if (NULL == pos)
    return MHD_NO;
  pos->header = key;
  pos->header_size = key_size;
  pos->value = value;
  pos->value_size = value_size;
  pos->kind = kind;
  pos->next = NULL;
  /* append 'pos' to the linked list of headers */
  if (NULL == connection->rq.headers_received_tail)
  {
    connection->rq.headers_received = pos;
    connection->rq.headers_received_tail = pos;
  }
  else
  {
    connection->rq.headers_received_tail->next = pos;
    connection->rq.headers_received_tail = pos;
  }
  return MHD_YES;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: I found no unreachable code fragments in the function. Rationale: the only early return is the NULL allocation check (if NULL == pos) return MHD_NO; that branch is reachable if memory allocation fails. The remainder of the function is the path taken when allocation succeeds. The conditional that appends the new header (if (NULL == connection->rq.headers_received_tail) { ... } else { ... }) has two mutually exclusive branches that are both potentially reachable depending on the runtime state of connection->rq.headers_received_tail, so neither branch is statically unreachable. There are no constant-conditional statements, no labels/goto or code placed after an unconditional return in the same execution path, and no dead switch/case or unreachable loop bodies. Therefore there are no code fragments in this function that appear to violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1.
